content.description: At the left end of the SE facing slab is a 5-foot wide slot with a hand to wider crack on its right wall. Climb the crack. Ben Boykin and I climbed this route in 2011. It's probably been climbed at an earlier time.

Climb the left-leaning, 5.6 offwidth to the right of the Old Bolted Routes and inside the slot formed by the slab and a big boulder. The offwidth transforms to a thin, right-leaning crack that ends near the 1st bolt. Make a delicate traverse leftwards to the 2nd bolt. Climb up past it  (crux) aiming for the obvious corbel. From there its easy climbing to the top.

See

The Palin Wall.

for

Tunnel Vision

.

See

Day of Wrath

. Climb the arching crack starting at the right (NW) end of the wall exiting through the vertical crack near the top of the arch.

This is a body length offset tight hands splitter.  Over the lip it turns into great hands, but it is suprisingly hard pulling over.  Start on the one good hand at the back of the roof.  Once over the lip, you can step off, or if you really want you can top out the boulder which gets really crumbly and licheny at the top.  It was named because John had just gotten a new pair of shoes, and he tested them out on the FA of this problem.
content.location: Once on 700N drive 0.3 miles and turn left on 700NA.  Take a right at the fork in the road about 0.2 miles further, and another right at the fork in the road after another 0.1 miles.  Park shortly after right where the slab meets the road.  Walk up the slab, following the obvious dike on the right.  Look to the right to spy a fire ring with some graffiti on the rocks behind it.  To the left of the fire ring you will see a big dead tree, and New Shoes is in the boulders right under that tree.

content.description: Fun, albeit low, moves on really nice rock.
content.protection: A pad and spotter for the top-out.
content.location:
This is the roof above

Lois

. Start on a jug and move out and rightish through the roof.

content.description: This is a very unique problem for Vedauwoo as it is compression climbing out a roof using big positive slopers.  This problem is distinct, because it is basically a huge cobble stuck to a roof, and as a result most of the rock on the problem is really fine grained.  Start on an undercling feature and slap out the roof, heading out right to exit up the tall easy slab.  The start of this problem is low to the ground and as a result you need to keep your feet on.  It was named after a bit of graffiti on a nearby rock.
content.location: Drive 700N and take the left turn after 700NA, which is still 700N.  Follow this to the large trampled campsite.  Walk to the right around the formation staying at the base of the dome until you encounter a dilapidated barbed wire fence.  Follow this fence up to the dome and it will lead you almost right to the problem, which is under a low roof on the north side of the dome.  It has a great view of Spelunk Spire and the other crags behind Reynold's Hill.

content.description: Starts in the same place as Meat Milkshake, but moves up and left on good rock, using some of the coolest holds on any boulder in Vedauwoo.
content.protection: Two pads is plenty, the line is pretty low, but it is possible to take a hard fall.
content.location:
Up above

Lois

, on the same boulder as

Meat Milkshake

.

content.description: While this thing is pretty steep and looks like it might be hard, the slab to the side makes it much easier than it appears.  The crux is the exit.
content.location:
It's one fin before

Galactus

towards Upper Devils.

climbs.name: Formicae
climbs.fa: Cory Fleagle, prior to bolts being placed

content.description: This is on the lower Northeast Slab. It has a bouldery start, per-move bolt clips. It is quite thin. The name is Latin for "ants," which abundantly populate this slab. The bolts were installed without prior knowledge of previous ascents, in late July, 2011. The bolted version was first lead 8/5/11.
content.protection: 4 quickdraws (recommended single locking 'biner on the first clip).
content.location: Stem the corbel with your left hand, place your left foot here as well.

content.description: On the left (SW) wall of the hallway is a large, arching crack, which at its top is intersected by a vertical exit crack. Climb the arching crack starting at the left (SE) end of the wall exiting through the vertical crack near the top of the arch.
content.location:
See the beta photo for

The Panhandle

.  The first opening along the ledge  mentioned in

Barbed Wire

is a hallway big enough to walk into.

content.description:
The route starts about 10 feet to the right of

Sarah Palins Drill

. Climb an easy, left-leaning slot. The climbing suddenly becomes harder as the slot bends right and the climbing changes to underclings. Follow the crack to a small gully and then up an easy slab (1 bolt) to the top.

See

The Palin Wall.

for

Tunnel Vision

.

Ben Boykin and I climbed this route in 2011. It's probably been climbed earlier.
content.protection: Protection: #.5-#5 Camalots (also #6 if cautious), 1 bolt.  Gear anchor.

content.description: This is a classic Vedauwoo OW.  The crux is in the first 20 feet where the crack does a dogleg to the left and overhangs a bit.
content.protection: #6 Camalot, Big Bros to 10 inches, a 14 inch Valley Giant or Big Bro for the top.  It has natural anchors.
content.location:
This is on the east side of Limbo Rock aka Upper Devil's Playground above a new 4 bolt sport route "

Formicae

."  From the top of that route, go up and left into a hidden alcove with two OW cracks.  The right one is Crack to Nowhere.  Walk off to the north or find the rap station for "

Sara Palin's Drill

" a few feet to the SW.

content.description: Climb the nice, but short, handcrack formed by the blade. The angle then eases and the crack widens. Follow it to a chimney. Slither along the bottom of the chimney, as if crawling under barbed wire, to the easy-looking vertical exit crack (crux), which is size-dependent. The bigger you are the harder it will be.
content.location:
Barbed Wire,

Day of Wrath

, and

The Panhandle

are accessed by scrambling up the northeast side of Limbo Rock and moving to the southeast side along the ledge at top of Formicae. There are a series of cracks from moderate to huge along the ledge.

Barbed Wire

starts at the third crack on the wall, which has a large blade of rock on the left side of the crack. See the beta photo for

The Panhandle

.
